p.s: Experiences as a volunteer in Education Center in India, Delhi
Bianca L. is an 18-year-old German volunteer who worked in an Education Center for children in a slum of Delhi in India.
The following report is about the experiences she made there working with children.
A normal day in her life there looked like this: At first she had breakfast at 8:30.
At 10 o'clock she left the apartment and went to the Center by a Rikscharickshaw.
Then she gave English grammar lesson for the boys from 10:30 and more or less until 12 o'clock.
The next two hours she had lunch break and then she went on with teaching the girls the englishEnglish grammar from 2 pmpost meridiem until 4 pmpost meridiem.
Bianca said that the children were the most important thing for her there.
She was surprised by and enthusiastic about the kids.
She told that she never met anyone who had so much love in their heardshearts than these children had eventhough they were in such a bad situation and had not a good fate.
She enjoyed every day she could spend with these children who were full of love and aan acceptance.
Bianca also described those children she really loved as curious and fulfull of joy and she was very impressed by the love for life that they had.
For her it were the best days of life there in the slum with the children.
She loved the job she did and every single day she was with the kids she laughed eventhough she mighmight was a bit tires and frustrated.
The children gave her love, hope, patience, confidence and she was so thankful and glad she could gain this experience.
Because Bianca is a good friend of mine I am happy for her and I wish this is going to be the best time of your lifeslives too when you decide to take part in a volunteer program too.
